intro: Origanum elegans, commonly known as slender oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its essential oils, rich in compounds like carvacrol and thymol, contribute to its strong aromatic profile. It is often used in culinary and medicinal applications due to its flavorful and therapeutic properties.
